column1: Please remember to wear a mask social distance avoid traveling and stay safe.

Black people are nearly 5x more likely to be hospitalized after contracting COVID & 2x as likely to die. We must dismantle racism in our health care system & support medically underserved communities with tracing & testing.  Proud to be working with @SenWarren on this effort. https://t.co/HKzqYvxisK
Reminder: a COVID relief bill has been sitting on Mitch McConnell’s desk for 50 days while millions struggle to keep food on the table.
When Mitch McConnell demands liability protections in a COVID deal this is the kind of corporate malfeasance he’s trying to protect. https://t.co/3ZzfpDHaiM
Wear a mask and social distance. Check in on your family and neighbors. We're going to get through this but we have to work together https://t.co/u2XMdff693
Wear a mask social distance and look out for one another.  This fight is far from over.

COVID-19 has taken over 243000 lives in our country and yet there is still no national testing strategy and Senate Republicans continue to block urgently needed relief.   Lives are on the line and we must act immediately. https://t.co/YRPtWic2nV

Saddened to hear my long-time friend & former Ghanaian President Jerry John Rawlings passed away from COVID-19. He can be credited with ushering in democracy in Ghana & changing the landscape of African politics. My condolences to his family as his soul returns to his maker. https://t.co/XHhaD4V7qs

COVID-19 jeopardizes decades of progress and U.S. investment in global child health and survival. We must work together to make sure gains made are not lost.   This #ChildHealthWeek let’s pave a new and better way forward for children everywhere.
Wear a mask social distance and look out for one another. This fight isn’t over.

What we could pay for over the next year if we cut the military budget by 10%:  ✅ 684855233 COVID Tests &  ✅ 820000 Hospital Stays for COVID-19 &  ✅ 788461 People receiving $600 weekly unemployment payments  It’s past time we end wasteful spending & invest in the people.
Reminder: the House passed a robust COVID relief bill 23 days ago.   It’s been sitting on Mitch McConnell’s desk while he rushes through a SCOTUS confirmation vote just days before an election.
Abortions are safe effective health care. Don't let Trump a science and COVID denier tell you otherwise.    Listen to the medical professionals.

We've eclipsed 200000 deaths from COVID-19 & this weekend Trump knowingly endangered Secret Service members to carry out a political stunt & admitted he's "learning a lot about the virus" now that he has it.  Trump has made clear that he doesn't care about anyone but himself.

We must provide resources for low income & communities of color to conduct life-saving services to combat COVID-19.   My legislation w/ @RepKarenBass @RepRobinKelly @JoaquinCastrotx @RepDebHaaland @RepDavids & @RepJudyChu allows communities to build trust & save lives. https://t.co/Lt70E5a9yN
186000 people have died from COVID-19 and 800000 filed for unemployment last week. #ButHerHair https://t.co/zphqt9u88E

Systemic racism can be found in nearly everything. Racial injustices in health care are a matter of life & death & COVID-19 has only made matters worse.   I’m working w/ @SenWarren & @RepPressley to address these disparities in public health outcomes. It's unacceptable. https://t.co/n4OXd7GBAa

UPDATE: I joined my colleagues @RepSylviaGarcia @rosadelauro & others in a letter to Robert Redfield demanding answers on the CDC's deeply concerning decision to no longer recommend testing for all those exposed to COVID-19. https://t.co/VAwWwexayP

It's been 100 days since the House passed the #HeroesAct to fight COVID-19.   How many days must American families and frontline heroes go without desperately-needed support before Republicans in Congress are ready and willing to act?
Wear a mask social distance and be kind to one another.

The GOP is shamefully working to shield corporations from liability if their workers get COVID-19.   We cannot allow them to give companies protection from cutting corners on safety measures especially as cases continue to rise.
If we cut the military budget by 10% we could buy approximately:  225871999 coronavirus tests 563425 monthly relief payments of $1200 270444 COVID-19 patient hospital stays
The economic and racial disparities of COVID-19 are clear. It’s past time to eliminate the policies that allow for this inequality to persist in our country.  https://t.co/8uC9jIyYHv
The lack of resources to keep people safe in prisons is appalling. We must act to address the COVID-19 crisis in prisons.   https://t.co/U233xMqMPw
Roger Stone gets to walk free while millions of non-violent offenders face a COVID-19 death sentence in prison. Where is the equal justice in that?

By over-prioritizing the Pentagon with billions spent on endless wars pentagon contractors waste fraud and abuse our country is drastically underprepared for COVID-19 or any other crisis. This must end.  https://t.co/GdvvubiI2S
Health experts agree—the World Health Organization is an important tool to fight a virus that knows no borders. But Trump would rather blame others than fix his COVID failures. #WeNeedWHO
With a record number of new COVID-19 cases this administration is trying to dismantle our healthcare system. We cannot stand for this. It’s time for #MedicareforAll.

Underinvestment in public health has led to 10 times more deaths from COVID-19 than the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. This is shameful. Congress must act NOW to end wasteful military spending and invest in public health.  https://t.co/wdwUC3S1oY

While the world responds to the devastating COVID-19 crisis the climate catastrophe continues to get worse. We need leaders who can deal with the reality of the threats facing our country.  https://t.co/QmnPtimELU
Wear your masks.  Stay inside.  Social distance.   We can only beat this if we call work together.
REMINDER: Trump is still pushing racist and xenophobic rhetoric to pass the blame for his failed coronavirus response.   It’s COVID-19 – not any of the slurs Trump uses. https://t.co/fNNW4HqO0U

CA saw record breaking cases in #COVID19 yesterday. We must continue to adhere to social distancing and wear masks. Do your part to help keep your community safe and slow down the spread of this virus. https://t.co/obzwzClKDi
People are getting bills for upwards of a MILLION DOLLARS for #COVID.   It's time for #MedicareForAll. https://t.co/gqskBY2kRx

*taps mic* Finalizing this rule during the #COVID-19 pandemic which is disproportionately affecting Black people and other people of color is par for the course for an administration known for its cruelty. https://t.co/vpQhdbbojl

We just reached more than 2 million confirmed COVID cases.    Families are still struggling to pay the bills.   Trump's response to this public health crisis has been a total failure. https://t.co/5xAmnfOpPG
‘Pandemic Within a Pandemic’: Coronavirus and Police Brutality Roil Black Communities https://t.co/cl9HEp9MU0

Join my Facebook Live with Dr. Teisha Turner to talk about mental health awareness and resources during COVID-19 and the #JusticeForGeorge protests. We’re going live at 2pm PT on my Facebook. https://t.co/jMf3TeshNA

This inequality is at the heart of every crisis we’re dealing with right now – the crises of police brutality and mass incarceration the #COVID19 public health crisis which is disproportionately affecting communities of color. #TRHT

The murder of #GeorgeFloyd and the current #COVID19 crisis illustrates once again the painful and dangerous legacy that white supremacy has had on our country and the desperate need to fully acknowledge and understand how our history of inequality continues today. #TRHT

Trump: -ignores an emerging health crisis for weeks -blames other countries for his lack of response -touts dangerous medical advice -pulls out of the WHO in the middle of a pandemic   His unscientific and negligent approach to COVID is a danger to our national security. https://t.co/661fwkAkHL

Our country has lost 100000 people to the COVID pandemic.   They are overwhelmingly our nation’s vulnerable – the poor the elderly and people of color.    As we mourn we have to address the inequalities that blocked so many from the care they needed. https://t.co/X0TrfJdDUz

This is a tragedy.   100000 mothers fathers brothers sisters.  Trump refused to take action to stop the spread of COVID early — and this is the cost.  My thoughts and sincerest condolences are with the families and loved ones of these 100000 people.  https://t.co/vpXSQiYWwq

Black-owned businesses and entrepreneurs already face huge barriers to entry – COVID is only making it worse.  We need more relief aimed to help keep minority businesses afloat. https://t.co/FT5Ys9HMk6

Completely not shocking that Trump launched another politically-motivated attack on reproductive health to distract from their botched coronavirus response.   At this moment we need more health care not less. https://t.co/ijsAIW1tXw

Nearly 100000 Americans have died from COVID-19.  But yet Trump spends his weekends playing golf.   Let us take a moment to remember each of these individuals & act to save lives. #StayHomeStaySafe https://t.co/PEqYtXmAyB

During Asian Pacific American Heritage Month it’s more important than ever to stand in solidarity with the #AAPI community and denounce the alarming rise in anti-Asian bigotry we are seeing due to #COVID19. This is unacceptable and must end. #StopAAPIHate #APAHM2020
Join me and @RepRoKhanna for an Instagram Live discussion on the race disparities of COVID-19 treatment + federal support.   Join us Today at 5:30pm PT/8:30pm ET! https://t.co/f4a06K0es9

If you have lost a job or access to health care due to the COVID crisis affordable health insurance & free testing is available at https://t.co/he9ingDYxT. More than 120K have signed up during this special enrollment period ending 6/30.
The American people don’t need more resources allocated to already bloated Pentagon spending.  Instead we should redirect these resources to combating #COVID19. https://t.co/FtDHXK6LyQ

Trump continues to blame other countries and organizations for his failure to respond to COVID.  The WHO isn't the reason we're in this crisis: your refusal to listen to scientific experts and recommendations is. https://t.co/A2Az3Zcidr

Transit workers are working the frontlines of COVID everyday to get health care workers grocery store clerks and other frontline workers.  We need to ensure they’re protected as well. https://t.co/pEV5BnYpO9

We are facing the worst health and economic crises of our lifetime. The #HeroesAct does critical work to keep families healthy and out of poverty.  But even before COVID 140 million people lived in poverty.  We need to challenge ourselves to rethink what we accept as “normal.” https://t.co/30VC4w8VDz

On #EndangeredSpeciesDay as we all focus on the COVID-19 crisis remember human health & lives depend in so many ways on the health of wildlife. The biodiversity extinction on this planet is another crisis that will cause untold harm. We must defend the Endangered Species Act!
Immigrants pay taxes contribute to our communities and work on the frontlines of COVID.   They deserve access to vital resources too. #HeroesAct

Thank you to the Oakland City Council for passing an emergency ordinance providing 80 hours of sick leave to workers affected by COVID-19. Should be the norm for all workers not just during crisis. https://t.co/PE3iFXhqfi
HAPPENING NOW! Join me and @RepPressley on my Facebook page for a discussion on reproductive justice criminal justice and health disparities in COVID-19. https://t.co/NdXpQohcE8

HIV – People living with #HIV disproportionately suffer from underlying immunosuppression that puts them at greater risk for COVID-19. The #HeroesAct gives additional funding to HIV/AIDS clinics to keep them open and funding to HUD to help keep roofs over people's heads. (6/6)

Don’t miss out! @RepPressley and I will be discussing COVID-19 reproductive justice the criminal justice system and racial health disparities at 3pm PT on my Facebook page. Join us! https://t.co/NdXpQohcE8

Want to know more about how COVID is affecting communities of color criminal justice and access to reproductive care? Join my Facebook Live with @RepPressley tomorrow at 3pm PT! https://t.co/NdXpQohcE8 https://t.co/qhSS2djqqU
City and county governments are on the frontlines of the coronavirus crisis. If we’re going to keep people safe and healthy they need all the help they can get. https://t.co/2Z827tqmYc

Communities of color and low-income communities were already at risk of being undercounted – and COVID-19 has only made that more likely.   Our communities literally can’t afford not to get counted. #GetCounted https://t.co/jTjt4nGDAi

Join me and @RepPressley for a Facebook Live for a discussion about COVID's effect on abortion access criminal justice and racial disparities.   Join us on Wednesday at 3pm PT/6pm ET! https://t.co/AO7KkLCE6g

Listen to medical experts! If you’re leaving the house it’s critical you wear a mask – for your safety and the safety of those around you. To paraphrase Smokey the Bear only you can prevent COVID spread! https://t.co/v30KEKg0xb

Make no mistake: there’s no reason immigrants shouldn’t have access to COVID19 resources.   I’m pushing hard to ensure that no one is locked out of the next relief bill. #ForThePeople #PeopleOverProfits https://t.co/LO2rUa5SOY

City of Berkeley is now offering free testing to anyone who lives or works in Berkeley and has symptoms of COVID-19. Call 510-981-5380 to speak to a nurse and make and appointment. https://t.co/9e4CXDPjoQ

Almost 40 million Americans lived in poverty before COVID.   With 20 million people newly out of work in April and millions more facing cutbacks that number WILL skyrocket.   We need to reprioritize and start putting #PeopleOverProfits. https://t.co/ybNOx1NxeG
Essential workers.  Lack of access to health care.  Blocked from safe housing.   We know why communities of color are struggling under COVID. It’s past time to act. https://t.co/ciqoo9GmAz
HAPPENING NOW: Join me and @liztheo to talk about the effect COVID is having on poverty around the country! https://t.co/6u9nTavjWg
2PM PT: I’m hosting a Facebook Live with @liztheo from the Poor People’s Campaign to talk about poverty COVID and a just economy. Join us! https://t.co/7U7kgkiVMf

We need COVID relief that gives direct cash payments to ALL households including:   👉🏾low- or no-income families that do not file tax returns👈🏾  👉families with ITINs including mixed-immigration-status families👈  #FundFamilies #COVID19

Communities across the country are facing unique challenges to COVID19.   Clean tap water is just one of the ways rural communities poor communities and communities of color are struggling right now. https://t.co/VfKd5TvASn

Our nurses are on the frontlines of COVID every day risking their lives to protect us. Let’s help our nurses combat this pandemic by continuing to take the necessary precautions.   To all nurses your expertise care and compassion are appreciated! #NationalNursesDay https://t.co/WWGUsTntrz
TOMORROW: I’m going Live with @liztheo from the @UniteThePoor to talk about how COVID is pushing more and more people into poverty around the country. Join us at 2pm PT! https://t.co/cYTvrVoApz

A just response to the #COVID19 crisis must address racial and economic disparities in our county.   Today at 11am PT @USProgressives will discuss bold solutions to address this challenge and build a #PeoplesRecovery. Tune in ⬇ https://t.co/6HG8Lezbik

Black women already die during child birth more than twice as often as white women.  If more of these clinics close because of COVID those rates will skyrocket.  #BlackMamasMatter https://t.co/CqLVGpxeaa

It's never been more clear that #HousingIsHealthcare. Emergency #rentalassistance will not only keep the lowest-income families stably housed but it will also help to curb the spread of #COVID19 & save lives. Let's take action! #RentReliefNow https://t.co/5snscmORqZ

Spoiler alert: not well.  If the Trump Administration had taken COVID seriously from the start we could have had a much lower infection rate and fewer deaths.  Instead he chose to ridicule experts and put us all at risk. https://t.co/dvrhKDzIEl
We know why communities of color are facing higher death rates from COVID — it’s time to target the resources where they’re needed so that everyone can stay healthy. https://t.co/0tainOQksu

Generational poverty environmental racism and health disparities leave communities of color more vulnerable to COVID – and less likely to recover.  We need to ensure EVERYONE has the resources needed to survive this pandemic and thrive once it’s over. https://t.co/EN0r7x3Jzq

5G doesn’t spread COVID. Asian Americans aren’t more susceptible. Ingesting disinfectants won’t kill the virus.   Listen to health officials and experts – we need facts to stay safe not conspiracy theories. https://t.co/4S1BO16vm2

TUNE IN: I'm joining #TheSipHour for a virtual Sunday Brunch with @HigherHeights on FB Live at 2:00 pm ET for a conversation with Black women on the politics of hair #COVID19’s impact on the beauty industry & tips from celebrity hairstylists. https://t.co/O6xn1viS0s

Systemic and generational poverty is making the COVID-19 crisis worse for communities around the country.  We need to target resources to where they’re needed most – and ensure they can actually get there. https://t.co/tzUnxosDKs

The last thing people need is elected officials playing politics with abortion coverage during a pandemic.  The same communities who bear the brunt of abortion bans like Hyde are also some of the most harmed by COVID-19.  It's unacceptable and I won’t stand for it. #BeBoldEndHyde https://t.co/fq3XdtWE2g
HAPPENING NOW: I’m LIVE with @CSIS Global Health Policy Center Director Dr. Stephen Morrison to talk about the COVID-19 pandemic. Tune in! https://t.co/6u9nTaMVkQ

We cannot leave LGBTQ+ youth behind during the COVID-19 pandemic! LGBTQ+ youth are 120% more likely to face homelessness than their peers and they deserve to be centered in future coronavirus packages. #TrueColorsDay

Let me be clear: COVID-19 didn’t create poverty and inequality in the US it just exaggerated our existing crisis.   We need to ensure help is getting to those who need it most not the wealthy and well connected. https://t.co/boNJG5j66c
TODAY: I’m hosting a Facebook Live with Dr. Stephen Morrison from @CSIS to talk about the COVID-19 pandemic. Join our discussion at 3pm PT! https://t.co/7sHDYU8tKc

Got a question about the COVID pandemic? Submit it below for my Facebook Live with @CSIS Global Health Policy Center Director Dr. Stephen Morrison tomorrow at 3pm PT. https://t.co/llwB0LQuEv https://t.co/0Us8SnbmTk
Asian Americans are still being targeted with racially charged Coronavirus epithets and physical attacks.   There is never an excuse for racism. https://t.co/a4pPSYPE8i
We are failing communities of color.  We need data-based evidenced-based resources targeted to communities hit hardest by COVID. https://t.co/0yVmsdrDkY

.@RevDrBarber is right – poverty was a national crisis long before COVID-19. It’s our moral obligation to ensure everyone has a roof over their head and food on their tables.  We can’t stop fighting poverty once this crisis is over. https://t.co/PEW03ccC1t

WEDNESDAY: I’m hosting a Facebook Live with @CSIS Global Health Policy Center Senior Vice President and Director Dr. Stephen Morrison at 3pm PT. We’ll discuss international cooperation and global organizations during COVID-19. Submit a question below ⬇️ https://t.co/llwB0LyTfV https://t.co/q2osQCGCYa

It’s outrageous that large companies got funds meant for mom and pop shops in the first place. This is why we need a COVID Oversight Committee to ensure that taxpayer money is going to who needs it the most. https://t.co/0SnUwoRJrH

Many homeless Americans qualify for an Economic Impact Payment. Those who don’t normally file taxes have a quick and easy process to sign up with #IRS to get a payment. #COVIDreliefIRS https://t.co/p8YzpVvCJv
Evidence is piling up that communities of color are bearing the brunt of COVID-19.   Congress has a duty to help -- it's past time for us to act. https://t.co/Vk9tT42Pll
HAPPENING NOW: I’m talking about protecting people trapped in the criminal justice system and racial disparities in COVID-19 with @VanJones68! Join us: https://t.co/6u9nTavjWg

And there it is: Trump is using the coronavirus to push his xenophobic racist agenda. https://t.co/LpIB1ut4zz

Join me today at 4pm PST/7pm EST for @_shethepeople town hall today about COVID-19’s impact on communities of color. We all must come together to protect our vulnerable communities.  Register here: https://t.co/TxpSHwt2Su

I’ll be hosting a Facebook Live with my friend @VanJones68 to talk about the racial disparities in COVID-19 and how to protect those trapped in the criminal justice system. Fill out the form below if you have a question for either of us! https://t.co/BqtAi7kmVY https://t.co/ZI4V0Ku6wO

I’m hosting a Facebook Live with @VanJones68 on Wednesday at 3pm PT about racial disparities in the coronavirus pandemic. Submit a question for us below! https://t.co/BqtAi72Lxo https://t.co/lwpGeMNNkz

The stimulus check is intended to help individuals who need assistance during the #COVID19 outbreak. No one should be concerned that their checks can be garnished. That is why I am urging the IRS and Treasury to issue guidance to prohibit this. https://t.co/zQQal6Sm9N
🚨🚨I’m LIVE on Facebook with UC Berkeley Professor Dr. Art Reingold to answer your questions about the COVID-19 pandemic. Tune in! https://t.co/y9T0PHaIDC

We can’t let COVID increase the fault lines in our society. We need to #ReleaseTheData on racial disparities so that Congress can get help to communities of color. Glad to work with @RepPressley @RepRobinKelly @RepKarenBass and @SenWarren on this bill. https://t.co/aueeH8nD3x

Yesterday California started issuing the additional federal unemployment benefits Congress passed.  While this Pandemic Additional Compensation money will help millions of families during this difficult time I am fighting for more relief for all those impacted.  #COVID19

Do you need health coverage due to the #coronavirus? You can enroll now in a health plan through Covered California due to the #COVID19 crisis and may be eligible to receive financial help to reduce what you pay for coverage. Get started here. https://t.co/nF7rjtL4CQ
If you’re a renter or landlord here’s everything you need to know during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/tWCAdU0qYX

Communities of color are being hit harder by coronavirus – and Mitch McConnell and Senate GOP are refusing to help. It’s Congress’ job to keep everyone safe and healthy regardless of the color of their skin. We need the data! https://t.co/0Dl6eTxZEK
#COVID19 has proven how dangerous employer-based health care is.  We know the solution – it's time for #MedicareForAll. https://t.co/A29wxC6Ah4

Communities of color are dealing with deadly #COVID19 outcomes because of structural racism.  Food deserts redlining discrimination in health care/housing have all caused increased rates of asthma diabetes heart disease and other COVID risk factors. https://t.co/uCQzUQAGrK

Glad we were able to get a provision in the Senate bill requiring CDC to report racial data on COVID. Shameful that Senate Republicans just blocked it.     If Congress is going to help the country we need to know who's being affected.  https://t.co/hgzjP2K5JF

TONIGHT – join me for my tele-town hall about #smallbusiness #unemployment and #paidleave assistance available during #COVID19! Call 866-757-0660 at or before 6pm (no access code required). https://t.co/UKTGHb5oXN

Decades of structural racism have prevented communities of color from accessing quality health care – and the coronavirus crisis is blowing these disparities wide open.    Congress needs the racial disparity data to address these issues. https://t.co/WYGIyV5w72

TOMORROW: I’m hosting a tele-town hall at 6pm PT to keep you informed about resources available during the #COVID19 pandemic. I hope you’ll join me by calling 866-757-0660 at or before 6pm (no access code required). https://t.co/pSz1ThrubA
Our health care system shouldn't prioritize profits over patients.   #COVID19 has just proven one thing – we need #MedicareForAll and we need it NOW. #WorldHealthDay

-High blood pressure -Diabetes -Asthma   Communities of color across the country experience higher rates of conditions that put them at risk with #COVID19. We need accurate and up to date data on racial disparities during this pandemic. https://t.co/3BTbOxW0zL

So great to see our communities coming together like this. Comment below with your friends neighbors or loved ones who have gone above and beyond to help others during the coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/RyreUw0Oeo

Great FAQ from @sfchronicle answering your most pressing coronavirus questions – including how to keep yourself safe when leaving the house. https://t.co/q5o9DSYpGO

You can get fresh air while being socially distant! I took a walk and thought about the great education I got at @UCBerkeley – and students across the country who are struggling right now. The #CARESact provides student debt relief but we need to do more for #DebtFreeCollege. https://t.co/kwNKyRcclP
Preventing protecting people from the spread of coronavirus means everyone – including those in jail. We need to do more to keep inmates healthy. https://t.co/28lspyYlbh

Powerful words from my friends @RepGraceMeng @RepJudyChu and @RepMarkTakano. Calling coronavirus the “China Virus” isn’t just racist – it puts Asian Americans across the country at risk. https://t.co/0Ge85kWAYa
We need a ban on all evictions during this public health crisis. Glad to see this important step from @GavinNewsom #COVID19 https://t.co/wy9SA6Lzyo

This is a new low – Trump and his anti-choice cronies slipped an expansion of the dangerous #HydeAmendment in the Coronavirus relief bill.   They're exploiting a public health crisis to push their anti-choice agenda. It's dangerous offensive and WRONG. #BeBoldEndHyde

EAST BAY RESIDENTS – I’m hosting a tele-town hall tomorrow at 6pm with @SBAgov and Lifelong Medical Clinic to give you updates on the #coronavirus epidemic and resources to keep small businesses open during this trying time. Information on how to join below. https://t.co/a0FTiNsFMp
The Trump Admin is blocking a global response to the coronavirus pandemic because of their xenophobic agenda.  People will get hurt because of this. https://t.co/T8HSdii61d

No one should have to worry about keeping a roof over their head during a public health crisis. This is a good step towards ensuring our families are safe during the coronavirus epidemic. #PeopleOverProfits https://t.co/NzwvwsVhyr

This coronavirus crisis is hard on everyone and it’s showing how the actions of our community impact us all. #Census2020 will determine the public health funding that our community gets for the next decade. Respond online now. #WeCount ⬇️ https://t.co/NYJkcP1lWJ

No one should be forced out of their home in the middle of a public health emergency. Proud to work with @RepChuyGarcia on this critical bill to protect renters during the #coronavirus epidemic. https://t.co/gPgbfm9DbB

Getting #coronavirus isn’t just you getting sick – it's the potential of passing it on to those who are at higher risk of complications. Don’t just keep yourself safe – keep the community safe. https://t.co/oJiDkrck3c
Good list of common misconceptions and frequently asked questions about #coronavirus from NPR ⬇️ https://t.co/LucrUQILcS

For weeks the Trump Admin didn't take the #coronavirus pandemic seriously – and by the time they did hospitals and doctors were overwhelmed.    We need to do everything we can to ensure our frontline workers have the equipment they need. https://t.co/r1UNYsWFIz

A #coronavirus side effect you might not have considered: Canceled blood drives & fewer available blood donors. If you are healthy and eligible please schedule a @RedCross blood donation appointment to help overcome a severe blood shortage. #COVID19 https://t.co/fuLtpY5kRr

We’re facing a global pandemic – yet instead of calming the nation and urging cooperation Trump is inflaming tensions. Calling #coronavirus the “China Virus” is dangerous and must stop.    https://t.co/QqCJDAjd5J
@SFBART is reducing hours to limit the spread of #coronavirus. M-F trains will run 5am to 9pm and weekend service will be limited to 8am to 9pm. https://t.co/eW8REagDyG

I know this is a scary and confusing time for many of us. But it's critical that we listen to our public health officials and do everything we can to #FlattenTheCurve. #coronavirus https://t.co/6AEg7U6NYR

I want to make sure you have the latest information about the #coronavirus how to stay safe and what resources are available to help you and your family. My website is updated every day with the latest ⬇️ https://t.co/LGr4kh97MN

There’s a lot of confusing information about what the shelter in place order means. Check out the graphics below for some of the most common questions and answers. #COVID19 #Coronavirus https://t.co/7rtdJRdkyh
No it’s definitely racist and unacceptable. Especially when you have public health officials telling people NOT to call coronavirus the “China Virus.” https://t.co/eY2FC6rfpi
